description.narrative: Stronger national organisations to deliver emergency preparedness & response and in 5 countries National organisations are better represented and have a stronger voice in relevant humanitarian platforms and networks in their countries START Network agencies (INGOs) recognise and respond to national organisations' voice and agency Evidence of good practice in strengthening local organisations’ humanitarian capacities and their role/ influence in humanitarian action is documented and shared beyond the project

capacity building-conduct humanitarian capacity assessment, develop learning models and framework to be used in humanitarian capacity building, support partner identify capacity development priorities, develop peer to peer mentorship schemes, conduct ToT across humanitarian framework, facilitate annual self-assessments against the humanitarian capacity framework. National Platform: conduct round table discussions with local organization to identify priority humanitarian issues for collaboration and capacity building, identify relevant platforms and networks in country where partners can participate, facilitate engagement of networks representing affected communities in humanitarian forums and co-ordination, build awareness of available humanitarian funds and resources. Research learning and evaluation: establish research and evidence gathering working group across participating organizations and partners,conduct research on best practices, produce case studies and publications, disseminating findings through national regional level and international consortia.
